meanings.definition: To make or become English in form or character.
meanings.sent1: She anglicizes her speech when talking to English friends.
meanings.sent2: The immigrant anglicizes his name to fit in better.
meanings.sent3: The cat anglicizes its meow to sound more like the neighbor's cat.
meanings.sent4: The artist anglicizes traditional Japanese art techniques in her paintings.
meanings.sent5: The old house anglicizes its architecture to appeal to modern buyers.

meanings.definition: To adapt to English customs or traditions.
meanings.sent1: He anglicizes his wardrobe by wearing suits to work.
meanings.sent2: The family anglicizes their holiday celebrations by having a Christmas dinner.
meanings.sent3: The dog anglicizes its behavior by wagging its tail when greeting guests.
meanings.sent4: The company anglicizes its marketing strategies to attract more British customers.
meanings.sent5: The school anglicizes its curriculum to include more English literature.
